intro: Cryptantha ramulosissima, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and open woodlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seed pods that split open when mature. Cryptantha ramulosissima is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates.
